parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
An OAuth Access Token with scopes:
  • webhook_write
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.

parameters.name: x-api-user
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: x-on-behalf-of-user
parameters.description: The userId or email in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. of the user that has shared his/her account

parameters.name: WebhookInfo
parameters.description: Information about the webhook that you want to create

errorResponses.reason: BAD_REQUEST: The request provided is invalid.
DUPLICATE_WEBHOOK_CONFIGURATION: There is already a webhook registered with same configuration.
INVALID_ARGUMENTS: One or more arguments to the method are invalid.
INVALID_JSON: An invalid JSON was specified.
INVALID_WEBHOOK_CONDITIONAL_PARAMS: The webhook conditional parameters specified are invalid.
INVALID_WEBHOOK_RESOURCE_ID: The resource id specified is invalid.
INVALID_WEBHOOK_RESOURCE_TYPE: The resource type specified is invalid.
INVALID_WEBHOOK_STATE: The webhook state specified is invalid.
INVALID_WEBHOOK_SUBSCRIPTION_EVENTS: One or more webhook subscription events specified is invalid.
INVALID_WEBHOOK_URL: The webhook url specified is invalid. Please provide a well-formatted https based url.
INVALID_X_API_USER_HEADER: Value provided in x-api-user header is in invalid format.
MISSING_REQUIRED_PARAM: Required parameters are missing.
WEBHOOK_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: Webhook limit for this resource and event has exceeded.
INVALID_ACCESS_TOKEN: Access token provided is invalid or has expired.
INVALID_USER: Invalid user ID or email provided in x-user header.
NO_AUTHORIZATION_HEADER: Authorization header not provided.
UNAUTHORIZED: You cannot work on behalf of this user.
UNVERIFIED_USER: The user has registered but has not verified their email address. The user must use the Adobe Sign web site to complete verification.
API_TERMS_NOT_ACCEPTED: Your account is locked because an administrator has not agreed to Adobe Sign's Terms of Use. Please contact your account administrator to activate your account.
PERMISSION_DENIED: The API caller does not have the permission to execute this operation.
WEBHOOK_CREATION_NOT_ALLOWED: Webhook creation is not allowed.
MISC_SERVER_ERROR: Some miscellaneous error has occurred.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:

  • webhook_read
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.

parameters.name: x-api-user
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.description: The userId or email in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. of the user that has shared his/her account

parameters.name: showInActiveWebhooks
parameters.description: A query parameter to fetch all the inactive webhooks along with the active webhooks.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope of webhook. The possible values are ACCOUNT, GROUP, USER or RESOURCE

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: The type of resource on which webhook was created. The possible values are AGREEMENT, WIDGET and MEGASIGN.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Used to navigate through the pages. If not provided, returns the first page.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of intended items in the response page.

errorResponses.reason: BAD_REQUEST: The request provided is invalid.

INVALID_X_API_USER_HEADER: Value provided in x-api-user header is in invalid format.

operations.summary: Retrieves the details of a webhook.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
An OAuth Access Token with scopes:
  • webhook_read
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.

parameters.name: x-api-user
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: x-on-behalf-of-user
parameters.description: The userId or email in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. of the user that has shared his/her account

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Pass the value of the e-tag header obtained from the previous response to the same request to get a RESOURCE_NOT_MODIFIED(304) if the resource hasn't changed.

parameters.name: webhookId
parameters.description: The webhook identifier, as returned by the webhook creation API or retrieved from the API to fetch webhooks.

errorResponses.reason: RESOURCE_NOT_MODIFIED: Resource is not modified.
INVALID_X_API_USER_HEADER: Value provided in x-api-user header is in invalid format.
MISSING_REQUIRED_PARAM: Required parameters are missing.
INVALID_ACCESS_TOKEN: Access token provided is invalid or has expired.
INVALID_ON_BEHALF_OF_USER: Invalid user ID or email provided in x-on-behalf-of-user header.
NO_AUTHORIZATION_HEADER: Authorization header not provided.
API_TERMS_NOT_ACCEPTED: Your account is locked because an administrator has not agreed to Adobe Sign's Terms of Use. Please contact your account administrator to activate your account.
PERMISSION_DENIED: The API caller does not have the permission to execute this operation.
INVALID_WEBHOOK_ID: The webhook id specified is invalid.
MISC_SERVER_ERROR: Some miscellaneous error has occurred.

applicationDisplayName.description: The display name of the application through which webhook is created

applicationName.description: The name of the application through which webhook is created

created.description: Timestamp when the webhook was created. Will only be returned in GET request. Can't be modified in PUT request

id.description: The unique identifier of the webhook. Will only be returned in GET request. Can't be modified in PUT request

lastModified.description: Timestamp when the webhook was last updated. Will only be returned in GET request. Can't be modified in PUT request

resourceId.description: Id of the resource type for which you want to create webhook. Provide agreementId if webhook needs to be created for an agreement. Similarly, widgetId if webhook needs to be created for a widget and megaSignId if webhook needs to be created for a megaSign. Need to specify only if scope is 'RESOURCE'. Can't be modified in PUT request

resourceType.description: The resource for which you want to create webhook. Need to specify only if scope is 'RESOURCE'. Can't be modified in PUT request. The possible values are AGREEMENT, WIDGET and MEGASIGN.

scope.description: Scope of webhook. Can't be modified in PUT request. The possible values are ACCOUNT, GROUP, USER or RESOURCE

state.description: The state in which the webhook should be created

status.description: Status of the webhook. Determines whether the webhook will be actually triggered. Default: ACTIVE, if ACTIVE, this webhook will receive event requests. If INACTIVE, this webhook will not receive event requests. Can't provide status in POST/PUT requests.

webhookConditionalParams.description: Conditions which webhook creator can specify for the payload while creating or updating a webhook

webhookSubscriptionEvents.description:
Determines events for which the webhook is triggered. The possible values are
AGREEMENT_CREATED : When an agreement is created
, AGREEMENT_ACTION_DELEGATED : When an agreement is delegated
, AGREEMENT_RECALLED : When an agreement is recalled
, AGREEMENT_REJECTED : When an agreement is rejected
, AGREEMENT_EXPIRED : When an agreement expires
, AGREEMENT_ACTION_COMPLETED : When an agreement action is completed
, AGREEMENT_WORKFLOW_COMPLETED : When an agreement workflow is completed
, AGREEMENT_EMAIL_VIEWED : When an agreement's email is viewed
, AGREEMENT_MODIFIED : When an agreement is modified
, AGREEMENT_SHARED : When an agreement is shared
, AGREEMENT_VAULTED : When an agreement is vaulted
, AGREEMENT_ACTION_REQUESTED : When an agreement action is requested
, AGREEMENT_ACTION_REPLACED_SIGNER : When signer is replaced for an agreement
, AGREEMENT_AUTO_CANCELLED_CONVERSION_PROBLEM : When an agreement is auto-cancelled due to conversion problem
, AGREEMENT_DOCUMENTS_DELETED : When an agreement documents are deleted
, AGREEMENT_EMAIL_BOUNCED : When an agreement email gets bounced
, AGREEMENT_KBA_AUTHENTICATED : When an agreement KBA is authenticated
, AGREEMENT_OFFLINE_SYNC : When an agreement is synced offline
, AGREEMENT_USER_ACK_AGREEMENT_MODIFIED : User Acknowledgement when an agreement is modified
, AGREEMENT_UPLOADED_BY_SENDER : When an agreement is uploaded by sender
, AGREEMENT_WEB_IDENTITY_AUTHENTICATED : When an agreement web identity is authenticated
, AGREEMENT_ALL : All the supported agreement events for Webhooks
, MEGASIGN_CREATED : When a megaSign is created
, MEGASIGN_RECALLED : When a megaSign is recalled
, MEGASIGN_SHARED : When a megaSign is shared
, MEGASIGN_ALL : All the supported megaSign events for Webhooks
, WIDGET_CREATED : When a widget is created
, WIDGET_MODIFIED : When a widget is modified
, WIDGET_SHARED : When a widget is shared
, WIDGET_ENABLED : When a widget is enabled
, WIDGET_DISABLED : When a widget is disabled
, WIDGET_AUTO_CANCELLED_CONVERSION_PROBLEM : When a widget is auto-cancelled due to conversion problem
, WIDGET_ALL : All the supported widget events for Webhooks

webhookAgreementEvents.description: Conditional parameters for webhook agreement events

webhookMegaSignEvents.description: Conditional parameters for webhook megasign events

webhookWidgetEvents.description: Conditional parameters for webhook widget events

includeDetailedInfo.description: Determines whether agreement detailed info will be returned in the response payload

includeDocumentsInfo.description: Determines whether document info will be returned in the response payload

includeParticipantsInfo.description: Determines whether participants info will be returned in the response payload

includeSignedDocuments.description: Determines whether documents will be returned in webhook response payload. If set to true, signed document will be returned in base 64 encoded format in JSON when signing is complete

includeDetailedInfo.description: Determines whether megaign detailed info will be returned in the response payload
Determines whether agreement detailed info will be returned in the response payload

includeDocumentsInfo.description: Determines whether document info will be returned in the response payload

includeParticipantsInfo.description: Determines whether participants info will be returned in the response payload

WebhookCreationResponse.description: A JSON  that contains the id of the newly created webhook

id.description: An identifier of the webhook resource created

page.description: Pagination information for navigating through the response

nextCursor.description: Used to navigate to the next page. If notreturned, there are no further pages.

applicationDisplayName.description: The display name of the application through which webhook is created

applicationName.description: The name of the application through which webhook is created

id.description: The unique identifier of the webhook. Will only be returned in GET request. Can't be modified in PUT request

resourceId.description: Id of the resource type for which you want to create webhook. Provide agreementId if webhook needs to be created for an agreement. Similarly, widgetId if webhook needs to be created for a widget and megaSignId if webhook needs to be created for a megaSign. Need to specify only if scope is 'RESOURCE'. Can't be modified in PUT request

state.description: The state to which the webhook should be changed to
